content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Sure, here's a simple function in Julia that does this:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Convert to lowercase and strip leading/trailing whitespaces
    cleaned_col = lowercase(strip(col))

    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscore
    cleaned_col = replace(cleaned_col, r"[\s-]" => "_")

    return cleaned_col
end
```

You can use this function to clean up any column name:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("Another-Column Name")
"another_column_name"
```
